hints.content: When a figure is rotated $90^\circ$ about the origin, every point $(a,b)$ on this figure maps onto the point $(-b,a)$.

For example, the point $N (-7, -3)$ on $\triangle{NOW}$ maps onto the point $(3, -7)$.

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/80c5c4577d93dcaebf15a7cd6bcfbb3576a374a6)

The image of $\triangle{NOW}$ under a rotation of $90^\circ$ about the origin is displayed below.

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/c0522b93baf7f6c40cad3f09100f90d8ba191113)

question.content:
$\triangle{NOW}$ is rotated $90^\circ$ about the origin.  

**Draw the image of this rotation using the interactive graph.**

*The direction of a rotation by a positive angle is counter-clockwise.* 


[[☃ interactive-graph 2]]

hints.content: When a figure is rotated $360^\circ$ about the origin, every point on this figure maps back onto itself.  *In other words, the figure and its image are the same!*

The image of $\triangle{HEY}$ under a rotation of $360^\circ$ about the origin is displayed below.

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/d80e2afce16ccc98a879880fc4bc9ba98e5cd98e)
